intro: Dichapetalum hypoleucum, commonly known as the white-flowered dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas.
